intro: Mespilodaphne veraguensis, commonly known as the Guanabana or soursop, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Caribbean and Central America. It belongs to the Annonaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and fragrant, white flowers. The plant produces a large, spiky fruit that is typically green when mature, though it may turn yellow or red depending on the variety. The fruit contains a white, fibrous pulp with numerous large, hard seeds. It is valued for its edible fruit and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
